page.title: 17Community and facilities D/W
page.content: Denchworth has 10 families with children under 16. There are about 13 children and 120 adults. The average age is 50. On Thursdays, the old people have a Whist Drive. There is little else for the people to do in their spare time in the village itself. There is very little employment available in the village. Jobs are in Oxford, Abingdon, Wantage, Swindon and Harwell. Employed people are teachers, servicemen, Harwell scientists, businessmen or writers. Denchworth has very few facilities. They have a pub, The Fox, a mobile grocery van and a mobile post office for stamps and pensions, an informal game of cricket once a fortnight and a weekly church service. Sunday School is once a month. Children and younger adults go to Hanney and Wantage for recreation and shopping.
